title: Particle motion, given acceleration part - b

content.question: Write an expression for the position x(t) of the particle at any time t ≥ 0.

frqParts.text: Write an expression for the position x(t) of the particle at any time t ≥ 0.

topic.text: 7.7: Finding Particular Solutions Using Initial Conditions and Separation of Variables

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
